reviews.text: Nice little port with very good restaurants and historic buildings. This is definitely one of the nicest places in Bastia. You should not miss this if you are in Bastia. Recommended!
Amazing, you're projected into another dimension where people co-habite in peace. It reminds me that we're all one.
Nice place. Old port is good place for evening walking, a lot of restaurants, cafe, bar. Big choice for the finishing full of activity day.

Beautiful small old port with beautiful old houses around and wonderful citadel above it.
There are a lot of cosy places near to seat and enjoy coffee or whole meal.
There are also free parking places here.

It's OK from the point of view of ease of access to centre of Bastia town, and under normal circumstances would have probably been fine for a few days. Unfortunately there were some very noisy works going on during our stay which made it quite untenable. However, the staff were very helpful...

It's a beautiful city, with beautiful architecture and streets, BUT the people are awful.... Africans and Arabs everywhere. Sorry, but I don't like It. Whenever I go to western Europe, I want to feel like I'm IN EUROPE. Not In the middle East or Africa.

Petite place plutôt agréable pour ce faire une petite pause. 
Il y a tout ce qu'il faut, banc, arbres pour l'ombre, poubelles quelques bar tout autour et le vieux port a 20 secondes à pied, parfait.
Superbe bâtiment chargé d'histoire
Cet édifice habite les services de la mairie de Marseille, il a une histoire puisque c'était un prison et un tribunal, très belle construction
Bel exemple d architecture  du Classicisme  Français  du XVIIIE

The cathedral la major is beautiful inside and out. It has a familiar architecture to the Duomo in Florence, Italy. Entrance inside is free. I also love the mosaic tiles on the floor of the building. You should make a quick stop if you are in the area.
A must go place for those interested in history and the seamen way of life, fears and thoughts, not just the religious side of it. Amazing views of the city and coastal landscapes.
Impressive architecture detail and intricacy. Every part of this building is detailed richly with the religiously cultural expression of the time.
Nice place for tourists and locals. Outstanding example of architecture and very characteristic place for Marseille. Obligatory place to see! You can smell the history inside cathedrale La Major.
Nice place near by Marseille center. It is on the coast with lovely look on the seaside.

First Sunday of a month museums are free. Art was really nicely exposed. Unfortunately no English descriptions, half of the exhibition in art museum was closed. Good place to take nice pic,after few minutes - nothing to do.
The Parc Longchamp deserves visiting. Really enjoyed walking. Also there are two very interesting museums.
Must to visit place. Longchamp metro and T2 tram line are very close to entrance. WC on the territory. Great place for picnic and relax
Absolutely incredible.  With so much beauty, it would be good to clean up the graffiti
Stunning celebration of the canal project delivering fresh water to Marseille completed in the 1860s

Only visited the top sun garden that can be reached from fort Saint-Jean on a metallic bridge. This walk gives you an iconic view of the port and the town. The top of the museum was very nice, have free sun beds and a restaurant. Ideal place to relax while sightseeing in Marseille and to catch the nice seabreeze. Visit the exhibition too if you have the opportunity.

Amazing construction. Is for sure a must see, combining the old with the new and the historical with modern art , this is a place you will remember forever! The buildings itself are a piece of art. There is 2 concrete bridges from 1 build to the other that look great from far and ever better standing on it. The inside tours are payed but you can walk the bridges and the outside of the buildings for free.

This Museum has comprehensive and essential information for tourists to understand about the history of Marseille as well as Mediterranean tradition/convention/history. There are a few theatre of showcasing different segment of history. I would recommend to travellers who are interested in knowing about local history.
Modern and old looks georges.  Coffe inside were you ca  relax and enjoy the sea view.  In the evening is a great spot to see sunset.

Waste of money. Service doesn't speak in English, they can't explain even basic things, like inform where is the entrance... We had to go around the MuCEM because of wrong information. Secondly, there is a problem with signs, we didn't know where we exactly should pass off. Apart from that messy exhibiton without proper order. I don't like it at all. The only thing that rescue this place is the form and external look.

We were having dinner, the food was fine. But two guys had stolen phone from my husband's backpack. The tables are standing very close. That's strange that the waitress didn't clean the table after the old lady, even when two men sat down at that table. Soon they left, I'm sure that they had stolen the phone.
Never coming back to that place. 1 and a half hour for taking an order, expensive, bad attention and bad food.

Don't ever go here. The food was horrible. I also was yelled at by the owner or a waiter for using the bathroom without permission. Didn't know paying customers had to 'ask for permission' to use the restroom. His friend, who sat on another table, sat there and laughed. I wouldn't support a business like this.
Terrible customer service. Our food took over 45 minutes to arrive. Food was ok but over priced. We will not be returning.
Horrible

One of the single best meals we had while in France.

Who I assume was the owner read the menu from a chalk block, personally for us in English. Was jovial and recommended a sampling from the menu.

He brought out an incredible assortment of some of the freshest, most deliciously and simply prepared fish I've ever eaten. I am not what you would consider a fish person, but every thing was so delicious. We all cleaned our plates and shared everything family style.

Such a wonderful restaurant and excellent experience. Deserves Michelin, but may have been too unpretentious. :D
Nice place to eat well cooked and fresh fish
Excellent food, well priced. Book ahead. Be prepared to share a table.
Super food and great location!

Quirkily decorated place dishing out fresh seafood in unique ways. The sea anemone and the sardine balls were my favorite part of the menu and they have great wines to pair. One staff understands English very sparsely so come prepared. If you’re more than one traveler, you should try their whole fish that they cook

Recommended to go here by a local and we had a great meal. The seafood is very fresh. If you're looking to try out a new sea creature that you haven't had before, here's probably the place to do it. Suitable for those who don't eat raw seafood as they do serve hot food such as fish and chips too.

This is a street food style restaurant where you would order at the counter both food and drink, drink is given to you at the counter, find a place to sit and they bring out the food to you on a platter or cardboard plates, nothing fancy just really good seafood. Seafood is fresh.
Nice friendly staff and delicious seafood. Many options to choose from. Not the cheapest place but fairly priced. Overall a good choice. Would go back.
Fresh seafood as you can see in the pictures. From the market (in the front of the restaurant) directly to the table.
Amazing fresh seafood, delicious oysters, crab soup. Serveral plates to choose from. Service brusque but vite.

The food was good but the quaintly was less for entrés. The place looked lovely online as per the reviews but sadly there was no service whatsoever at the restaurant. 
The owner ( quite unsure if he was the owner or the manager) was cold. 
Service requires a huge improvement.

Heavenly, must try place if you love vegetarian food. Great place to sit and relax at cours de Julien.
But, BEWARE: Service is just 'missing' though. Not just bad, but absent... That needs to improve drastically. Nobody seemed interested in any customer. Rating only for food.

We went yesterday to what we thought was le Cours en Vert but saw the name Mikala instead. 
The menu was very limited 3 main dishes and somewhat pricey for what they offered.
The food was cold.
I would not recommend this new place.
Delicious food and they were kind enough to let us eat there even though we arrived at closing time. Would most certainly return!
Fantastic place and great vegan food! Great area too, plenty going on 👍
Visited 13/11/18. Outstanding food service and location and catered well to two Aussies with almost zero french language. 100% would return!
Amazing food. Worth a trip to Marseille just for this restaurant. If you do the chef's tasting, don't get filled up on the delicious bread. You can't take home your leftovers.

Delicious and enjoyable experience.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.  We ordered the "Fanny" tasting menu which was some of the best seafood I've ever had.  Unfortunately the bread selection was amazing as well and we got so full!  The scallops were the highlight of the meal for me.
Great location with fine dining sensibilities.
Amazing experience!

Very nice place for ice cream, and a special sort of ice cream. My friend and I were informed that this is one of the best places to get ice cream, and perhaps one of the best in France. So we visited, there was a line, a small line, and there was outdoor seating which was full. So we got our ice cream, I 3 flavors and for my friend 2 flavors, and we began to enjoy the ice cream. It was pretty good. It was a very thick ice cream and certainly deserving of the colloquial award of the best ice cream place. Certainly a place to visit.
Had the sorbet (3 flavours). Out of this world. Definitely try!
Super tasty ice cream with great raw materials

Good, fast service. Quite nice Illy espresso. Pleasant staff.

I needed a place to sit and do some work, while others wanted to get some rest and ice cream. This place was a good choice, despite the fact their internet connection did not live up to my expectations. But I'm tough to be pleased customer, when it's about WiFi quality, so I will grant them the credit of the doubt. It's clear they did whatever they could to serve my requests, so despite the fact they failed to provide up to my expectations, I still give them 5* for the effort, the great coffee, their ice cream and good service.
OMG best icecream I have had for years!
A great place for seafood lovers! This restaurant is located in a small Port, peace heaven 5 minutes away from Marseilles bustling city center. Just go,.and enjoy the Mediterranean....

Highly recommended for the most authentic Boulliabaise around. Service staff friendly and warm. Prices are reasonable for cuisine of this excellent standard. Will definitely want to come back. Wine list is wallet friendly
Nice people, but it's not worth the money (53euro per person) to get the bouillabaisse. Like they give you tons of fish, but most of them are tasteless.

only chef’s special menu available
abd it’s pretty good
It is obvious there put lots of love into the food they serve, it’s really fresh and well presented. Located in a hidden charming part of Marseille.

Love this restaurant. It was my first 3* (i went to several other since) and that was a great experience. I don’t think I’ve eaten a better fish since. Thanks for this amazing time. From the first bite to the herbal tea and chocolate at the end. Everything was perfect.

Love the hotel room, view and the cuisine. Not a big fan of the deserts for dinner, also breakfast looks weird because it's a big selection of bakery, but cakes isn't something you go to the three Michelin stars..... the rest of breakfast is not that rich. Stuff is nice and friendly.

What ever your expectations from this restaurant, it will exceed it. The Food and service are truly excellent.

The above images are from the Bouillabaisse Set Menu priced at €210 on 16/Oct/20018.
Great view! Food is very nice as well. But i miss the WOW of a 3 start restaurant..... And also one of the most expensive 3 star restaurants.
On everyone's list of best places in Marseille, because it undisputably is. The abalone is definitely an acquired taste, and not mine. But every other dish wowed.

Love this restaurant. It was my first 3* (i went to several other since) and that was a great experience. I don’t think I’ve eaten a better fish since. Thanks for this amazing time. From the first bite to the herbal tea and chocolate at the end. Everything was perfect.

Love the hotel room, view and the cuisine. Not a big fan of the deserts for dinner, also breakfast looks weird because it's a big selection of bakery, but cakes isn't something you go to the three Michelin stars..... the rest of breakfast is not that rich. Stuff is nice and friendly.

What ever your expectations from this restaurant, it will exceed it. The Food and service are truly excellent.

The above images are from the Bouillabaisse Set Menu priced at €210 on 16/Oct/20018.
Great view! Food is very nice as well. But i miss the WOW of a 3 start restaurant..... And also one of the most expensive 3 star restaurants.
On everyone's list of best places in Marseille, because it undisputably is. The abalone is definitely an acquired taste, and not mine. But every other dish wowed.
